Reviews.Title: “Charming but poor value”
Reviews.Author: MSir
Reviews.Content: This is based on a stay in room 9. Great location, friendly staff, lovely landscaping, cozy gas burning fireplace. However, for $200 you get a room that is only big enough to fit the bed in and a "patio" that is really the landing to the room that is three feet from the parking space. For the money, try exploring any number of the great B&B's in the area so you won't feel so cooped up! Room was clean, but hardly luxury. I can't speak to the other rooms, but avoid #9!

Reviews.Title: “A Great Place”
Reviews.Author: Beth I
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here about a month ago together, while on a trip to CA just the two fo us. WE were both very pleased with the location of the Inn, and even more impressed with the staff. Everyone was very kind, and gave of us tips of the best local places to visit.

Reviews.Title: “Best Napa Trip!”
Reviews.Author: briguy410
Reviews.Content: We arrived after midnight, quite exhausted, but found a very warm reception from the Inn keeper and an unbelievably clean and comfortable suite. The fire was burning bright and the jacuzzi tub was a welcome treat to our tired travel bones. I recommend Christopher's Inn 7 days a week on twice on Sunday! Cheers, Brian

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay”
Reviews.Author: Andy2112
Reviews.Content: We thought this was a great place to stay when in Calistoga. it is not a spa but there are plenty close by. It is a little pricey but so is everything else in Napa Valley. The TV is not great but no one comes here to watch TV. I was very pleased with our location and accommodations and would have changed very little.

Reviews.Title: “The Sweet Smell of Spring”
Reviews.Author: Jenniferbrooke
Reviews.Content: At first I was skeptical after looking at users photos but with a last minute trip we had no other choice! I was really scared to learn I was getting the same room, but was ever o pleasantly surprised. Warmed pastries, decanted wine and a roaring fire awaited me. The bathroom was mildew free , dated but reminded me of taking a bath at grannies house - the sounds f birds were amazing along with the fountain. As an avid bird watcher I was pleasantly surprised to see a varied thrush as well as an Oregon junko and humming bird all in one tree mean while a scrub jay and robin hoped on the ground ! I wanted to break out in song! The woman st the front recommended great spots that we could walk to so the night turned out great, I can't wait for my next day off especially when more if these flowers bloom! Love Calistoga

Reviews.Title: “Cute, Charming and Cozy!”
Reviews.Author: BennyMac1971
Reviews.Content: We were able to make last minute reservations on a holiday weekend with no trouble. Cute, immaculate room walking distance to wine tasting and great food. Will definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing stay in California's Wine Country”
Reviews.Author: LynF224
Reviews.Content: We arrived at Christopher's Inn in on 25 September 2011 for a two-night stay and were greeted by the lovely Adele. Our room was extremely comfortable and the shower was invigorating, to say the least! The best shower we had in all our three weeks in beautiful California. Breakfast was really delicious - and such a lovely touch to be delivered in a basket. We had some really informative chats with Adele and had a great time tasting wine but, above all, relaxing in the tranquil atmosphere of the courtyard around the fountain, after a very hectic couple of weeks in which we drove 2,000 miles! My husband and I had a slight contra-temps with our travel agents, but, suffice to say, Adele came up trumps and upgraded our room from room 5 - to 6, then 7 - after she discovered I'd requested the travel agent to book room 10 and she could see how disappointed I was. All in all, we had a superb time at Christopher's Inn and I would certainly recommend this hotel for its hospitality and position just a few steps from the centre of Calistoga.

Reviews.Title: “Getaway from the City”
Reviews.Author: Nick C
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I were looking for a little getaway and found just that! Our room was really cozy and we loved the 2 person Jacuzzi. It is really close to town but nice and quiet. The breakfast in bed was a nice bonus.The receptionist was really helpful in giving us ideas of were to go and what to do! Overall it was a great stay and we will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Great place”
Reviews.Author: Bo S
Reviews.Content: Stayed in room 12 and it was beautiful. We came during October grape crush, Christophers Inn staff suggested a great winery called Grgich Hills Winery. Which is famous for beating all the french white wines.When we visted they were having an "I Love Lucy" grape stomping, after which we put our purple feet on a tee shirt. Never would have gone, if it had not been for the GREAT staff at Christophers Inn mentioning great things to do. Definitely will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Romantic inn close to everything”
Reviews.Author: Callicorrigan
Reviews.Content: I highly recommend this lovely inn close to downtown calistoga. Walk to dinner, wine taste, enjoy . This is just the break my husband I needed. Spotless rooms

Reviews.Title: “Great Honeymoon Suite!”
Reviews.Author: Shelly D
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were on out honeymoon when we stayed at this Inn, and they were great! The customer service was more than we expected it to be. When we told the owner we were on our honeymoon, we were upgraded to a suite for free. The area was great, and the rats were more than reasonable. We are definitely looking forward to our next stay at Christopher's Inn.

Reviews.Title: “Cozy and Lovely”
Reviews.Author: MaxMc99
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay at Christopher's Inn. Irene was extremely resourceful and so so friendly, that we felt quite lucky to come across such a lovely inn. There was even a sweet little cat named Milo who greeted us! We would certainly reccomend Christopher's to everyone coming through Calistoga CA. The room was very romantic and included a jacuzzi tub and a cozy fireplace. It's a quick walk to downtown Calitstoga and is conveniently located right across from a spa. 5 stars!

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the cost”
Reviews.Author: Ask4dug
Reviews.Content: Luxury of days gone by. Cute place not luxury at all! Shower stall and shower doors mildewed. Could go on but not worth my time spent to much already

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't have been better!”
Reviews.Author: Caryl S
Reviews.Content: Our stay couldn't have been better. The room was comfortable & charming. Breakfast at our door in the morning was a delightful touch. The innkeeper, Adela was incredibly helpful. She planned our itinerary for the 3 days we were there, including recommendations for dining & directions to everything. I would highly recommend Christopher's Inn

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced for the condition”
Reviews.Author: buggybug25
Reviews.Content: We stayed at 3 B&B's on our trip and Christopher's Inn was the most expensive, had the smallest room and bath and was the most 'worn out'. Pluses - The location is great - downtown Calistoga, walking distance to restaurants and breakfast (yogurt/fruit/granola, pastry, juice and coffee) was delivered in a basket to our room at 8am - a very nice touch. The room did have a gas fireplace. On the minus side - the room was tiny. The bath tiles had mold. The wallpaper was patched/missing in places and dirty around the fireplace. The room could really use a renovation.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place but not worth the cost”
Reviews.Author: azar44
Reviews.Content: I had no problem with the Inn itself, it was nice and cute and small and in a good location. The person who checked us in was very nice and friendly. But they seem to charge too much for what is offered. I chose this place because everything else was sold out or required a 2 night stay. In searching for a place to stay it seemed to me like Christopher's charges the same as the other places, but offers less. And the breakfast was delicious but so so small! Little tiny cup of yogurt, granola, and fruit, and little tiny squares of a pastry loaf. It was a fine place to stay, but next time I'd rather sleep at a campsite and save a ton of money.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in Calistoga”
Reviews.Author: BadAndy1
Reviews.Content: This is a great place to stay when visiting Calistoga. Though it isn't a spa, the quality and location allow one quick and easy access to local day spas. A bit on the pricey side, but welcome to Napa where everything's overpriced. Minor complaints - if you're a TV person, you'll be disappointed. But if you're in wine country to watch TV, maybe you should rethink your priorities. Mattresses tend to be soft. Great for some people, but just keep it in mind if you have a bad back - I always wake up stiff and sore. But what they heck... spas are all around! Breakfast could be better on the pastsry front - there are some decent bakeries in town that I would recommend the Inn look into for better pastries. But the knock on the door and the waiting basket are a lovely touch. If you're looking for things to do in Napa, just talk to the lovely woman at the front desk. She's a living encyclopedia of the area and she will supply you with more than enough suggestions of places to eat and things to see.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Spot!!”
Reviews.Author: lsegelquist
Reviews.Content: We had an awesome bed and delicious breakfast brought in a basket to our room to complete a perfect stay in Napa Valley! We went to the ball at Castello di Amorosa and this was the perfect spot to stay, great service and friendly people. You won't be disapointed!

Reviews.Title: “Above and beyond”
Reviews.Author: naturalldr
Reviews.Content: Planning a last minute trip to Napa, CA during the busy harvesting season proved to be extremely difficult. Falling upon the Christopher's Inn in the quaint town of Calistoga (about 10 minutes outside of St. Helena and Napa) could not have a bigger blessing. The room was extremely comfortable, and was a short walk from main street. This bed and breakfast is run by a lovely couple, Adel and Christopher, who bring every guest breakfast baskets in the morning. Additionally, there is complimentary espresso and wine in the lobby, which has a comfortable feel. In the midst of everything, we happened to notice we locked our keys in the car when we had checked out and were on our way to a mud bath appointment at a local Spa. Adel, took it upon herself to not only drive us to the spa, but additionally picked us up from our appointment so we did not have to walk in the rain. OUTSTANDING SERVICE!!! The Christopher Inn goes above and beyond in their care for their patrons. Even waiting for the locksmith to arrive, we had the opportunity to get to know Adel and Christopher even better, and cannot wait to return. They are beyond willing to share their knowledge of the town, and advice on the best local spots to dine. It would be a shame for someone to miss out on such an unique experience that the Christopher's Inn has to offer.

Reviews.Title: “Nice B&B but too Costly”
Reviews.Author: gonefishing85
Reviews.Content: This B&B is nice. The location is great on Rt. 29 in Calistoga within walking distance of downtown and drives to the wineries. The rooms were nicely decorated. Breakfast consists of juice, coffee, a pastry, and some fruit delivered to your room in a basket. I kind of expected more for the 200 plus dollars a night. It would not rank high on a scale compared to other B&Bs I have been to. I guess the location trumps the value. Note, you must pay in advance for your entire stay which can be risky. The other B&B we were planning to use is 2 blocks away and they did go out of business. It is nice but I would not go running back. I would try something in St.Helena next time.

Reviews.Title: “Please beware!”
Reviews.Author: naughty0512
Reviews.Content: Warning please do not be fooled by the many good reviews you read about this Inn. The not so good reviews are real. We stayed in room #14 for one night. There were cobwebs in the corner of the room along with a nice size spider. The carpets are very stained and dirty as pointed out by other visitors. The room was very dusty. I had a very difficult time breathing in the room and felt as if I needed fresh air constantly. If you have any respiratory problems take the advisement "stay away". My husband and I were very disappointed given the cost for the one night stay. The jacuzzi tub was nice but somewhat small for what was advertised as a two person's tub. Also they have a large size 19 inch television that stuck out too much from the dresser making it difficult to move freely past the bed. For the amount charged there really needs to be a plasma television in the room. Also there was a small patio area for the room that appears to have never have had any work at manicuring it's appearance. An awful waste. Despite everything else I must mention the woman that greeted me at the front desk was very nice, knowledgeable and was helpful with interesting sites to visit and other tidbits. The only thing that concerned me was when I was trying to give her the key the next morning, she was talking to someone and kept talking for a while. She never acknowledged me even though she did see me and when another visitor came up she started talking to them ending her conversation with the 1st party. I had to say excuse me to get her to respond and all I wanted to do was give her the key. I read quite a few reviews before making my choice and in doing so I saw that the manager/owner made after thought comments after some parties reviews. Most comments made were that the visitor should have told them their concerns. Well it was not until I was lying in the bed that I could see the cobwebs and spider. Also would they have moved me if I said it was dusty and the carpet is too spotty?Would they have had a better room as there were concerns reported by others about other rooms with similar problems. I will never know. They have to know already that the carpets are spotty and the cleaning staff should be checking for cobwebs daily. To charge over 300.00 a night is a total ripoff. The breakfast with two crossaints and a dessert dish of yogurt with a small amount of fruit was very minimal for the price you pay to stay. The basket with these items was left at my door and I did not hear a knock to let me know it was there so I really don't know how long it was outside my door. They gave us cups for coffee and coffee in a Karafe but only 3 sugar packets for two people. Until they take their customers and repetation more serious, please be aware. After you have paid your money it is too late. This is the only review I have ever written but due to my disgust I thought it worthy.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional service and very cozy place”
Reviews.Author: a_cajiao
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Christopher's Inn with our extended family that were visiting from abroad. Della (the owner) was so nice and welcoming; we felt as we were at home. She not only upgraded our rooms and gave us an exceptional customer service, but also took the time to review the many restaurants, hot springs and wineries that the area had to offer. Had a wonderful time during our stay and would definitely consider going back to Christopher's Inn in a heartbeat!!!

Reviews.Title: “Christopher's Inn is simply the best!!!”
Reviews.Author: AlohaMoreno
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Christopher's Inn for our honeymoon. When we mentioned to Adela (the owner) that we were on a honeymoon, she upgraded our room to a honeymoon suite and for free!!! Wow, that was really nice!!! Adela is such a wonderful person and gave us an exceptional customer service! She even took time to show us the Map of Calistoga and gave us tips on what's the best place to visit and tour around. Because of her tips we've seen the best wineries and even the ones that were hidden! The honeymoon suite was cozy and beautiful, we felt at home!! We are looking forward for our next vacation at Christopher's Inn!!!

Reviews.Title: “Reservation got cancelled”
Reviews.Author: texasayes
Reviews.Content: Wanted to stay and successfully made a reservation on-line. got a cancellation notice a few hours later. The web site is NOT in sync with the real reservations. Call directly to avoid disappointment.

Reviews.Title: “Pick another place”
Reviews.Author: coelac
Reviews.Content: Do yourself a favor and book somewhere else...I was totally unhappy with this place. Dusty, dusty, dusty. Probably because the location is right off of busy Foothill. Management can blame the cleaning staff, but who's in control there?If you WANT to stress out in Calistoga, then this might be your kind of place.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Romantic Getaway”
Reviews.Author: ancama
Reviews.Content: We found this place by complete accident. It was one of the only places in Calistoga with availability on Valentine's Day weekend. It couldn't have been a more perfect accident. The exterior is charming and quaint. The Inn keeper was friendly and gave personal to attention to each guest. This did mean having to wait a bit at times to speak with her, but her hospitality and knowledge of the local area was well worth a few minute wait. We had a couples massage in a quaint little massage room with professional staff, candle light, and soft music. Our room was beyond expectations with a fireplace, jacuzzi for two, comfortable bed, and sitting area all in romantic decor. Breakfast for two delivered in a basket to the door was the perfect touch to really make for a perfect end to a fabulous weekend. The location made for an easy walk to anything on the main road, and we were given more information regarding wineries and other fun things to do than we knew what to do with in a days time. We will most certainly be back and have already told all of friends about our great experience. We feel fortunate to have found stumbled upon the Christopher's Inn.

Reviews.Title: “Great Romantic Getaway”
Reviews.Author: schmidtmba
Reviews.Content: This was our third time staying at Christopher's Inn at Calistoga. They may be right off the main street but the Inn is quietly secluded. The rooms are very romantically appointed. We love the large jacquzzi bathtubs in the rooms. The beds are super comfy and down comforters to keep you toasty warm. Fireplace in the room. The staff are friendly and helpful. The breakfast is tasty and fresh (pastry, yogurt with fruit and granola, cheese, coffee or hot water for tea if you prefer, orange juice), delivered to your room between 8-8:30 AM outside your door. There are plenty of local wineries to visit if this is your persuasion, if not the art work at the wineries is fun to see. Great local color to see. Lots of local restaurants to enjoy with great food just a short walk away.

Reviews.Title: “Helpful and informative staff. Would definitely come back!!”
Reviews.Author: sharonc56
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I decided to take a somewhat last minute trip to Napa for the weekend. Without having any knowledge or experience of where to stay, we researched a few places and came across Christophers Inn in Calistoga. This Bed and Breakfast was great, clean and really comfortable. We didn't realize it was a little bit of a drive north of Napa, but we were not disappointed once we arrived. The location ended up being great, because we were able to walk to the center of town in the evening for dinner/drinks. We enjoyed it very much!! The breakfast in the morning was perfect; it was a nice and light beginning to the day. The delivery is a nice touch. I'd say the biggest impression was the kind woman who greeted us when we arrived. She was a wealth of knowledge and have her to thank for making our Sunday so much more enjoyable!! She recommended so many different places and even shared a little story as to why we should visit them. Overall, we had a great time...thank you!!

Reviews.Title: “Hidden gem”
Reviews.Author: Shuzuluza
Reviews.Content: Best price in calistoga and a nice room. Breakfast delivered to your door an added benefit. Just a block from downtown. Very helpful concierge. Great water pressure in shower.

Reviews.Title: “Quaint and Splendid”
Reviews.Author: Southeast83
Reviews.Content: This little inn is in a great community, peaceful and quiet, yet in the Napa Valley close to all the great vinyards. Breakfast in your room every morning and a terrific proprietor make this a must stay for a wine county visit.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it.”
Reviews.Author: StevenTAbell
Reviews.Content: Our room was beautifully decorated and very comfortable. The little patio was a nice place to have our breakfast. The short walk to downtown is very short indeed. The lady behind the desk was very helpful. We had a wonderful weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Quaint and quiet.”
Reviews.Author: samcharlesfineart
Reviews.Content: Great location for Calistoga restaurants and spas. Breakfast was delivered to our room in the morning - a lovely parfait with croissant, coffee and OJ. Flowery wallpaper and bed throw with plenty of pillows meant a comfy night was had. You have your own parking space as well. Lovely couple run the place and can direct you to any winery you'd like in the wine region. Thank you!

Reviews.Title: “Christopher's Inn at Calistoga, CA: A Good Base for Venturing in Wine Country”
Reviews.Author: WMT9
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at Christopher's Inn and look forward to visiting there again on future wine country visits. This inn is in no way pretentious, but strikes a fine balance between personal privacy and helpful advice for those who travel the roads and side roads of Napa and Sonoma valleys. So many small considerations: verdant landscaping, flowers, a glass of port, an expresso-maker for wine-weary travelers, and especially our personable hosts - all these helped make this a wonderful getaway. A fun stay!!

Reviews.Title: “Happy Accident - A beautiful and romantic inn.”
Reviews.Author: OCPB
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were delighted to decide over Saturday morning coffee to "just pack up the car and go - no reservation - nothing" - now you must understand that for a control freak turned empty nester - this is exciting but a little scary! We love Napa and our favorites are Harvest Inn on the more economic side and Poetry Inn for special occasions. After visiting our favorite winery - Sherwin Family (you must visit if you haven't) we decided to go to Sunshine Markets for some cheese and crackers and find a hotel. We called El Bonita feeling adventurous and always hearing such great things about this place - they told us they had two rooms available - one king so we took it. We arrived and the young lady who spoke with us was horrified to realize she made a mistake - not looking at her handwritten books and there was no room. At this point we are hungry, I'm a little grumpy and deciding that spontaneity is overrated! The El Bonita recommended we try Christopher's Inn - I thought Calistoga was a little out of the way but off we went - WOW - what an amazing happy accident. This place is truly a gem. From the wonderful friendly service to the proprietor helping my husband find a special room (22B) it was just a dream. This place is a destresser if I've ever stayed in one - beautiful decor, the most comfortable bed I've slept in ourside of our own, we had wine and cheese on our private balcony surrounded by beautiful trees and looking down at the charming old world fountain beneath us, we walked to dinner at Jole, which was very delicious, and returned with our own key to the Inn as it was after 10 and it was just fantastic. The next morning, a basket of breakfast goodies, orange juice and coffee appeared at our door. Also a bath in the spectacularly spacious jacuzzi tub. Wow - a great experience - I hated to leave and will definitely go there again. Try this one folks - after wine tasting all day, this is a great relaxing way to end your day and a truly romantic room.

Reviews.Title: “Old World Charm and Elegance”
Reviews.Author: heths
Reviews.Content: I found this inn on the internet and booked it for myself and work colleagues for the weekend. It was absolutely wonderful. It has old world charm, brilliantly located and the owners Chris and Adelle are extremely helpful and charming. The guided me to great winery's, excellent lunches and the only huge problem I had with the Inn was that I had to leave! The rooms were elegant and everything had that feeling that it was all hand picked furniture. No mass production at this Inn. It is a two minute walk to the town which is super when you want to have a good dinner and a glass or three of wne. I will absolutely go back not just once but for many a weekend and I plan to bring all my visitors from Europe to this great Inn where i was made feel so welcome.

Reviews.Title: “quaint and romantic oasis outside the bustle of Napa”
Reviews.Author: lilsurfergirl
Reviews.Content: Christopher Inn first of all is a perfect distance from downtown Calistoga, St. Helena, and a short drive to some of Napa's most luxury vineyards; however, it is tucked away on its own (on highway 29), so perfect for a couple to escape for the weekend. The innkeeper is incredibly helpful and zealous- she will tell you the history of various vineyards and provide you flyers for discounts as well.... Also, unlike many inns where you are careful not to make the floors creak or wake the neighbors, Christopher Inn has separate rooms in various little cottages - so it is perfect for a quiet, romantic escape in the sun.

Reviews.Title: “overpriced”
Reviews.Author: apeakhiker
Reviews.Content: We stayed at christopher's inn for our anniversary. I realize the Napa area is very expensive, butt we were very surprised at the size of the room. It was so tiny! There was more than one spider in the room. I thought the room was small but nice but the price mid week was way overpriced for what you get. The pros were the breakfast and te location. We will never spend that amount of money to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “An exquisite weekend getaway at a manageable price”
Reviews.Author: mhamula
Reviews.Content: From the momen we arrived a friendly face was there to check us in. We told her what we were looking to do with our weekend and she helped us put it all together. The room was impeccable, one of the comfiest beds I have ever slept in. And it had access to a private patio as well as complimentary breakfast (which was nice after wine tasting he night before). Calistoga is a great little town within 2 miles of the Castello di Amorosa winery. The town itself is worth visiting as it has a main street with multiple restaurants. If you stay at Christopher's Inn you get a 10% discount at a few of the restaurants. We went to the Calistoga Inn Restaurant and Brewery. The porter, duck breast, and summer risotto were fantastic. I liked the castle winery he best, althouh we didn't the full tour. They produce a great moscato there.

Reviews.Title: “loved the croissants, towels and cats”
Reviews.Author: sunshinestatedoc
Reviews.Content: An overall pleasant stay. Would love to go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay; charming and ideally located”
Reviews.Author: BTyerman
Reviews.Content: Came to Calistoga for a wedding and couldn't imagine a better place to stay. Walking distance to everthing. Charming unlike so many motel like properties in the area. HIGHLY RECOMMENDED!!!!

Reviews.Title: “A very lovely property”
Reviews.Author: Markie26
Reviews.Content: The service was exceptional. Adele was on top of everything. She never stopped. The room was very nice and clean. I loved the amenities. They smelled great. (soap/shampoo/cond) The location was right on Hwy 29. Easy to find. The grounds were pretty and clean. The breakfast was good also. Overall I liked everything and would stay again. What I liked the least was I had to leave. I would recommend this property to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “A WONDERFUL PLACE TO STAY”
Reviews.Author: LasVegasWestie
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have stayed at Christopher's Inn at least six times-for wonderful week-ends usually in early summer and again around Thanksgiving. Sometimes we have traveled with friends and everyone has enjoyed their stay. Calistoga is a great location and we love the town . The Inn is just that, an Inn-not a hotel and not a B and B. A charming country Inn. In the morning there is a tap on your door and a basket containing coffe, juice, fruit, and pastry is left for you to enjoy at your leisure. The proprieters could not be more accomodating., and they have great suggestiions for those who are new to the Wine Country area. We will be back at least once during the year. .Mary Krawitt

Reviews.Title: “Convinient and comfortable as home”
Reviews.Author: CAdventurexplorer
Reviews.Content: On May 24th my wife and three teenage children decided to take a short trip to Napa to see Chateau Montelena winery in Calistoga that was featured in the recent movie Bottle Shock. Although we have been in California for five years this was our first trip to Napa. While most B&B and hotels were booked on such short notice we were lucky to find a large room that slept five still available at Christopher's Inn. The staff were attentive and welcoming and the room was comfortable and spacious for all of our family. We especially liked the private entrance to our cottage of of a separate quite street from the hotel. Continental breakfast was delivered the next day to our door promptly at 8am which is essential with three hungry teenagers! The muffins, assorted fruit, granola, juice and both decaf and regular coffee provided for all five of us was great. We stayed in Room A3 which had two queen beds in separate bedrooms. In addition there is a single bed in the living room area. All three beds had there own TV's (also perfect with teenagers). Please be aware however that A3 has only one shared bathroom but it worked well for us during our visit. The hotel was very conveniently located at the entrance to the town of Callistoga and only a couple of miles from the winery and across the street from a great BBQ spot Busters. We also were able to go along the highway and visit other wineries nearby on the road to St Helena which was only a short drive away. We were very pleased with the location of the hotel and the small town feel of Calistoga. It was a nice place to unwind from the busy rush of Napa and St. Helena. We will definitely be back because the one reason for our trip was unrealized. Chateau Montelena winery was closed for memorial day on the day of our visit!

Reviews.Title: “Christopher's Inn- a big disappointment”
Reviews.Author: wintercat
Reviews.Content: We had reservations at Christopher's Inn for two nights this past weekend. Because there were 4 of us we needed 2 rooms. The woman we talked to on the phone recommended we stay in one of the cottages. When we arrived she was outside chatting with someone and told us to wait inside. We went in and found another couple waiting. Even though there were 2 parties waiting to check in she talked to the person outside for at least another 5 minutes. When she did come in she escorted the first couple to their room. While she was gone two teenagers rode up on bicycles. When she returned she helped them first although we had arrived first. Also, the girls were seeking summer employment, but she still made us wait. The cottage that we were given was terrible. It is not a cottage, but a house which has been divided into 2 parts. There was absolutely nothing charming about it. It had no internet, window air conditioners which had not been turned on in advance to cool the place and a tarp over the roof. One of the bedrooms had the tv up in the top shelf of the closet. It was at an odd angle for viewing from the bed. You couldn't watch it anyway as the plug did not reach the outlet. This cottage was so bad that 2 of our party went and checked in at another hotel down the street. The breakfast is also brought to your room in a basket. The coffee was not hot and the portions of cold breakfast were very small. It was not enough food and not up to what one expects for a bed and breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “35th Wedding Anniversary - Relaxed and Pampered”
Reviews.Author: Retired-Spoiled
Reviews.Content: We found Christophers Inn several years ago and have been going back ever since. The location is great, out and away from the hussle and bussle of the big cities, can walk to resturants. The rooms are very relaxing and romantic at night with the fireplace going. Irene is most enjoyable to talk with and makes dynamite recommendations. It is great to get the knock at your door at 8:00 am and have your breakfast waiting for you. We love this place and it always brings a smile to our face. All of our special occasions we find ourselves here. There is never a problem to big or to small, everything is always made right and perfect. We highly recommend it to all. We will be back..

Reviews.Title: “We will be back!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: quintessa90
Reviews.Content: We already stayed twice at Chrisopher`s Inn and we will go back. It is exactly the type of Inn that we like. It is cozy, well situated, the hosts are charming and discret. The rooms are comfortable and the breakfast are delivered at your door in a nice basket. You can take your 'apero' on the terrace and walk to your favourite restaurant. Really an excellent choice. Jacques Meunier and Brigitte Pion Pleasanton, Ca

Reviews.Title: “Great experience”
Reviews.Author: flygirldc3
Reviews.Content: The location is very central to the amenities of the Napa Valley. Service is most warm and welcoming, and this is the 6th year we have returned, so that will say a lot. We love the cottages that are rustic and cosy. Have checked out the rooms in the actual inn, and they are elegant but comfortable. Breakfast is delivered each morning in a basket to your door, so you do not have to stir early. The management is always full of suggestions and ideas for trips and restaurants. Overall, we cannot wait to go back for our 7th year.

Reviews.Title: “Chirstopher's Inn-a romantic secluded Bay Area Getaway”
Reviews.Author: MichelenJoe
Reviews.Content: What a lovely romantic getaway! This is a fantastic B&B with fantastic service. Christopher (and his staff!) made our QUIET getaway exacty what we wanted: romantic, quiet and lovely! Christopher's Inn is tucked away off of Highay 29 an worth the stay. It is charming, and fit our need for relaxation with spa treatments at Lavender Hill Spa (also a hidden gem!). Consierge service should take a seriouslook at Adele, and the staff at Christophers'--they will assist you (within reason) with you wants and needs as long as you return the courtesy by having manners, being polite and friendly. Try the Inn if you want to getaway and want quiet and romantic. Thank you, Christopher and Adele for a lovely time! Michele & Joe

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Stay at Christophers Again”
Reviews.Author: freespirit100
Reviews.Content: We stay at this wonderful little country inn every year for our anniversary. We spoil ourselves with the beautiful private massage room for two with a fireplace and two massage therapists. Prior to our massage, we rent bikes so the massage is a wonderful conclusion to the day. In 2008 and 2009 two movies were filed in town,and many of the stars stayed here. It was fun to hear the stories! We'll surely be back next year. Cant give up the breakfast in bed.

Reviews.Title: “A Sweet & Charming Little Getaway...”
Reviews.Author: bradbracher
Reviews.Content: This is my third stay here, and I am still wooed by it's charm. The hospitality is lovely, and a sweet little breakfast-in-a-basket greets you every morning. Though the Inn has expanded in size over the last few years, it maintains it's quaint nature. We will continue to return again & again...

Reviews.Title: “Hairballs and noise”
Reviews.Author: weekendvisitor2
Reviews.Content: We stayed in room #9 and heard the shower and neighbors talking. We also rececived a massage in the massage room and found hairballs on the floor and urine around the toliet. Lots of money for lots of funk,

Reviews.Title: “Wine Country Bliss”
Reviews.Author: mjalto
Reviews.Content: After several years, my wife and I returned to Christopher's Inn for a weekend getaway. We had stayed here 9 years ago and enjoyed our stay so much that it was an easy choice when deciding where to lodge. The property has grown quite a bit since our last stay, but the charm and great personal service still remains. Each room is unique and you can select the amenities that are important to you (ie. fireplace, jacuzzi tub, etc.). The owners, Adele and Christopher are very accommodating, friendly, and truly take an interest in your stay. Having been in the area for many years, they can advise you on the best restaurants, spas, wineries, and other attractions the valley has to offer. We enjoyed a fabulous massage and facial treatment from Lavendar Hill Spa and we had an outstanding dinner at Tra Vigne in St. Helena. We will return to Christopher's Inn!

Reviews.Title: “Romantic and Delightful Christopher's Inn”
Reviews.Author: slg57
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Christopher's Inn last week. Along with elegant and luxurious accommodations and atmosphere there was a welcoming and gracious staff and personalized attention. I especially enjoyed the fireplace and my husband loved the big comfortable bed! Beautiful antiques in the rooms...don't miss the Italian fountain, statues, plus the stained glass window in the main building. The sweet little town of Calistoga is a short stroll away, and there are some spectacular new wineries just down the road...ask owners and staff for recommendations. Now is a great time to visit as the fall colors are still on display and the weather sunny and crisp.

Reviews.Title: “nice but can be noisy”
Reviews.Author: Likesthebest
Reviews.Content: There aren't many places to stay in Calistoga. This is one of the nicest. The front desk is very helpful with ideas for places to dine as well as things to see. If you want a quiet night, book an upstairs room away from the highway. The morning basket was just the right amount of food to start the day. A group of us stayed there to be at a wedding. Everyone thought is was nice but over-priced.

Reviews.Title: “5 star all the way”
Reviews.Author: RazorModestoca
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I came up winetasting for a day and had one of the most fantastic stays I've ever had. The room was gorgeous and romantic. I wish I had a bed that comfortable at home. With a jacuzzi and fireplace in the room I could not go wrong my my better half. Breakfast in bed the next day topped it off. A very short walk downtown for an awesome meal and dancing at the calistoga inn. Am definitely coming back. Thanks guys it was FIRST RATE.

Reviews.Title: “Always an elegant experience”
Reviews.Author: ravield
Reviews.Content: Christopher's Inn always goes the extra mile to ensure your comfort; customer service is commendable. We took advantage of the restaurants that are well within walking distance and appreciated the 10% dining vouchers for those same restaurants. We love coming out in the Fall, but Christopher's Inn is top notch all year long!!!

Reviews.Title: “GoodVacation.”
Reviews.Author: Rydalbank
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful four night stay at Christopher's Inn. My Daughter two grandaughters and I really enjoyed ourselves. We had a delicious breakfast delivered every morning which started our day off right! Mrs. Terri Stewart. Sault Ste. Marie Ontario, Canada.

Reviews.Title: “Disgusting!”
Reviews.Author: Traveler1EastBay
Reviews.Content: We checked into our room and had a little time for a nap before heading out to dinner. Upon pulling back the covers, we discovered an old Kleenex and pubic hair in the sheets. It was obvious that the sheets had not been changed. When we notified the person on duty, they acted like it wasn’t a big deal and when we asked to speak with the manager, no one ever contacted us. It ruined our weekend and still makes be sick to my stomach thinking about it. Stay somewhere else!

Reviews.Title: “lovely B and B”
Reviews.Author: TravelMamma03
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Christopher's Inn for our yearly girlfriends getaway weekend. Five of us shared one of the cottages on the property. It was cozy and comfortable. We woke up each morning to baskets of goodies on our doorstep. The baskets contained yummy pastries, fruit, orange juice and coffee. The cottage was located within walking distance of Calistoga's downtown area. I had a 3 month old baby with me, so the convenience of the cottage being within walking distance of the restaurants was absolutely wonderful when he became fussy. We had a fabulous time going to the local wineries (Chateau Medelina and one that was modeled after an Italian Castle). We had spa treatments at Lavendar Hill Spa (which is within walking distance of Christopher's Inn). It was a memorable weekend of eating, drinking, pampering, laughing and fun! Calistoga is very charming.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet and Romantic”
Reviews.Author: Evergreen70
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently returned from a four day stay at Christopher's Inn in Calistoga, Napa Valley. It was our first visit to this Inn, and it exceeded our expectations! The best part about this location was that we could walk to the shops and restaurants in Calistoga. After driving around all day to wineries, this was such a treat! One would think that being so close to town would prove noisy when, in fact , the Inn was extremenly quiet and romantic. There is also a wonderful outdoor patio,with a delightful water fountain, where we would sit and relax before retiring for the night. The room that we stayed in was very quiet (unlike some Bed and Breakfast places where you can hear everything from the room next door!) and the bed was very comfortable. Each morning, a basket of breakfast goodies, coffee ,and juice was placed outside our door. We highly recommend Christopher's Inn for a romantic get-away when visiting the wine country! Evergreen, Colorado

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Omni”
Reviews.Author: fnshopn
Reviews.Content: Quaint. Just a block from downtown Calistoga so walking is easy. Lovely room, Laura Ashley decor. Breakfast basket delivered to your door each morning. Pastries were still warm, coffee hot, juice fresh squeezed! Cappacino machine in lobby. Susan, Brentwood, CA

Reviews.Title: “Loved this adorable B&B.”
Reviews.Author: studioteacher
Reviews.Content: Exquisite decor. Spacious rooms with high ceilings, a working fireplace with mantel, beautiful antique beds with mahogony head and base boards (the room next door (room 20) had a beautiful canopy bed. Charming Laura Ashley wallpaper and curtains. A combination of French and English antiques provide ultimate charm. A large hot tub in the bathroom. Newly renovated. A perfect environment while residing in Calistoga. Some cast and crew members from the film we were working on stayed here for 9 days, and we were all delighted. Adele, (one of two managers), was so helpful and knowledgeable of the wine tours and was always ready to assist.

Reviews.Title: “Can't beat Christopher's Inn”
Reviews.Author: e262
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful four night stay at Christopher's Inn. The inn itself is a very quaint and quiet retreat. The staff was very accomodating - even gave up their steamer to our room when they heard we were in for a wedding so we would be perfectly wrinkle free. Each morning we were treated to a breakfast basket delivered to our door and you can find port wine in the lobby in the afternoons/early evening. Upon check in they were extremely helpful giving us maps and tips on places to go. Dowtown Calistoga is only a block away from the Inn which made it very convenient to walk. The rates are reasonable, I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Awful”
Reviews.Author: dacoleii
Reviews.Content: I do not think it a very good thing to just rip a small place like this but if you expect service, cleanliness, or an overall enjoyable experience DO NOT STAY HERE. I was astonished at what they deemed exceptable to present to any customer.

Reviews.Title: “We loved Christopher's Inn”
Reviews.Author: winemavens
Reviews.Content: We were lucky to find Christophers inn and the charming town of Calistoga as the starting point for wine country trip. We enjoyed the breakfast basket in the morning, but the real highlight is the lobby with it's big fireplace, espresso machine, and a nice glass of port in the evening. After a long day of touring the wineries in Napa, Alexander Valley and Healdsburg, we found this place to be a pleasure to return to. The staff also gave us lots complimentary winery passes and such, which really added a lot to the experience. We really recommend Christopher's Inn, and will be returning there on our next trip to Napa and Sonoma.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Getaway at Christophers Inn”
Reviews.Author: munkeegrl
Reviews.Content: Looking on line it is really difficult to choose a place to stay in the Napa Valley. On a recommendation from the chamber of commerce visitor center we decided on Chrisophers Inn and it was perfect! I am not a big fan of the standard B and B which are usually smaller and often you run into other guests for breakfast etc. But I don't like boring cookie cutter Hotel chains either - Christophers Inn allowed for the privacy we want when we finally get some time together with out the kids but was also beautifully decorated with unique antique pieces. THe icing on the cake was the massages we had on the grounds - provided by the spa across the street-I would highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Country Charm”
Reviews.Author: Chilipprs
Reviews.Content: Lovely, relaxing stay in the wine country. We loved our experience at Christopher's Inn. The bed's were so comfortable that we didn't want to get up in the morning! A breakfast basket was delivered each morning with delicious pasteries and fruit. The ham and cheese ones were scrumptious! There was plenty of food and we kept some of the unfinished pasteries for a later snack. The decor is old Victorian full of antiques. We appreciated the comfortable, stress free surroundings. The owner's appreciation of fine art and antiques was evident by the decorating style of the rooms. The host and hostess were very friendly and advised us as to things to do in the area, They even supplied us with restaurant vouchers to use if we liked. The Culinary Institute of America is a must for a meal. The creme brulee is the best I have ever eaten. Also a real Castle down the road is a magnificent place for wine tasting. I would definitely recommend Christopher's Inn ........ in fact we are planning a return trip this summer.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Winter Holiday”
Reviews.Author: DebMStewart
Reviews.Content: LOVE THIS PLACE We had a wonderful vacation at Christopher's Inn. This is our 5th time staying at this lovely Inn. The bed's were so comfortable that my daughter's did not want to get out of bed! The basket of breakfast brought to our door each morning was delicious and certainly plenty. Those ham and cheese pasteries were devine. My daughters would take turns going to the lobby each morning to bring me back a steaming hot latte that they freshly brewed from a machine that was there. The staff has always been very friendly and helpful and they have always offered us coupons for restaurants in the area. WE LOVE THIS PLACE and will be back again in the summer.

Reviews.Title: “Stay away from Christopher's Inn.”
Reviews.Author: nantucketbasketlady
Reviews.Content: Stay away from the cottages at Christopher's Inn. The rooms are dirty (dust clumps on the floor, cobwebs galore, dust on table tops). The bathroom is dark and difficult to use (no towel rack, no table top for toiletry items). The furniture in the cottages is, for the most part, what I consider "yard-sale-find" condition. For a B&B, the breakfast is laughable—certainly inadequate for the four of us. We had to go out and buy additional food at a nearby bakery so that we wouldn't be hungry. I wish I had visited this website before we even considered making reservations! After two nights enduring the condition of the room, the noisy, paltry heating system, and the meager breakfasts, we decided to cancel our third night and find somewhere else more pleasant and possibly less expensive. In making our departure plans and unhappiness known to the innkeeper and his wife, we encountered rude, uncooperative behavior. Perhaps if the price had been less, our expectations would have been lower, but the price was inappropriately high for what was offered.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty Dingy Room”
Reviews.Author: the_Oh_No_Traveler
Reviews.Content: When I found the place I thought OH NO! bad location, right on the highway. As I entered the room I new I had made a BIG mistake. The room is tiny, date and dirty. The bedskirt actually looks brown where it touches the floor. Breakfast in the the room may sound appealing, not when it is delivered with a loud knoch at 8am. Again, a ride awakening! bathroom is seriously dated as is the decor to room. as another reviewer noted, the TV looks like it was purchased in 1980. Website PHOTOS are MISLEADING. DO NOT STAY HERE....

Reviews.Title: “Hated Christophers Inn”
Reviews.Author: queenmother58
Reviews.Content: I booked Christophers Inn for a Wedding. The room was horrible. We had to move our suitcases to the car after we unpacked because there wasn't any space in the room. The carpet was filthy and there was no lighting. No drawers at all in the room so we had to put our clothes on sheves. The day of the wedding, we got back to our room to dress and it wasn't made up. We were there for 3 nights. The sheets were never changed nor the shampoo replaced. Now I know why they asked for pre-payment in advance and they require a 3 nights stay if you book A Sat. night. Stay away!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: DaveHarry
Reviews.Content: I think people's experience of this place depends on the room they stayed in as they do differ quite a lot in both quality and price. We stayed in room 10 and, like the other room we stayed in, is a little tired and needs an upgrade (the TV for instance is pure 1980s!), it more than compensated for this with it's wonderful private patio and outside fireplace (well stocked each night). It was very romantic and we loved it. One major disagrement I do have with some of the reviewers is the attitude of the staff. We found them to be nothing but warm, friendly, helpful and, most of all, hugely knowledgeable about the area and what to see. Yes, it is expensive and, yes, it's time for a general revamp of the rooms but the location is perfect (5 mins walk from downtown calistoga), the staff lovely and, if you choose your room carefully, you'll enjoy a perfect stay as well.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience at Christopher's Inn”
Reviews.Author: wildtraveler
Reviews.Content: The staff was incredibly helpful and the location couldn't be beat. We stayed in room #10 which was pretty small but the private courtyard with fireplace made up for the room size. I admit that the Inn does show a little wear around the edges but the price combined with the location made it a perfect choice for us, and the ability to walk into town for coffee/dinner/window shopping was a real bonus. Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing & Dirty”
Reviews.Author: hrrsphr
Reviews.Content: From the Inn website we were expecting a charming place with beautiful rooms. We looked at several rooms and all had stained and dirty carpet, dingy comforters on the beds, and towels with stains. We stayed because we had no where else to go. The beds were the most uncomfortable we have ever been in and the noise from the continuous traffic on Hwy 29 made it impossible to sleep. The water pressure in the shower was so low that I could not wash the shampoo out of my hair. The 'Breakfast Buffet in Bed' seemed to consist of desserts that were left over from some local place-not breakfast food, room temperature coffee and warm orange juice. The only positive aspect was that you could walk to town for dinner (and breakfast if you wanted real food).

Reviews.Title: “false advertising”
Reviews.Author: GirlTravelor
Reviews.Content: We booked 5 rooms, got confirmation numbers, and were all set to head up to celebrate our mother's 75th birthday. We were notified a week later via e-mail (not even given the courtesy of a phone call) to say our reservation had been canceled because we had not booked a Thursday or Sunday night. Obviously someone had called them and wanted to book for a longer stay so they canceled our reservation. The website says NOTHING about having to have a Thursday or Sunday night. When we queried their action, the owner was rude, condescending, and suggested we take our business elsewhere. Easier said than done at this late stage. He stated that they "reserve the right to change their requirements as needed". If truth be told, they were simply not willing to honor the reservation because something else must have come up. Completely dishonest! We have traveled the world and NEVER dealt with a situation like this. We would NEVER attempt to stay there again nor would be suggest it to anyone else.

Reviews.Title: “Outrageous disregard for customers!!!”
Reviews.Author: 1of7
Reviews.Content: Do not consider booking with Christopher's Inn! They appear to have absolutely no commitment to the stated policies on their web site or, more importantly, the convenience/relationship with their guests. I booked 2 suites on their web sites for my mother's 75th bday weekend for Friday and Saturday nights and received confirmations (including confirmation #s). My sisters and I subsequently confirmed our plans, told my mother, and booked flights. With too little time to make alternative (comparable) arrangements, I received the following in a rude email from the proprietors: "We reserve the right to create booking patterns during the high season." In other words: we think we can probably rent the rooms out for three or more nights, so to heck with your confirmations. And the email closed with: "Perhaps you will be happier at the many other wonderful inns here in the Napa Valley." I guarantee you that we will be happier elsewhere and so should everybody else!!!

Reviews.Title: “Our Room had a Private Outdoor Patio and Fireplace which was very nice”
Reviews.Author: wkornele
Reviews.Content: Had a great time. The rates were very reasonable for Napa, the room was quaint, the staff was very pleasant and knowledgeable about both restaurants and wineries and had great recommendations on both. Got massages in the morning, wine tasting in the afternoon, dinner at night and then back to our room with a private patio and outdoor fireplace which was incredible. I would definitely recommend here and will be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Little peace of heaven”
Reviews.Author: Frenchmen
Reviews.Content: In desparate need of a little R&R, this was definitely the place. On the chilly evenings I didn't leave the room for being curled up in front of the fireplace. And then oh the giant bubble bath...then off to a bed of comfort from old Europe. I had not crawled into a pillow top down comforter since Germany 20 years ago. Fresh, clean, and oh, please walk the gardens as flowers everywhere. When not if I stay again, may pick a room with a garden patio, but again loved the huge rooms with no need to leave except for a few delightful spa treatments. The owner/managers are there if you need them and like little nomes make sure everything is in place without seeing it done. Felt safe and secure and walking distance to everything. Did not want to leave but duty called.

Reviews.Title: “don't let the outside fool you!”
Reviews.Author: jrk
Reviews.Content: This place is so over-priced it's insane! We stayed in room #15 and paid $330 a night for our room. It looked good on their web-site but let me tell you when we walked in I didn't know what was going on. The carpet is so old that there are brown dirt marks everywhere. The bed looked like it was about 30 years old and the mattress was actually suken in. Not making this up! You could actually see the giant dents in the mattress. The door to the patio had no lock but painters tape over the big hole in the door. The railing in the bathroom had been moved over because it was a handicap accessible room and they didn't bother to re-paint the wall. I didn't sleep all night because I literally sunk into the mattress with half my body so there was no way to get comfortable. I have never in my life seen a bed like this. The breakfast in the morning came in a nice basket but we were so creeped out at this point that we had no desire to eat it. My recommendation is to stay somewhere else unless you are getting these rooms for $100 a night. I have stayed in the South of France in much nicer rooms for less. The only decent thing about the room was it's size and the fireplace, but keep in mind it was quite scarry to light. A couple of times we thought the thing was going to explode. I would never stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the quaint charm”
Reviews.Author: pinkkitty
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Room #7 at the Christopher's Inn and it was such a charming room. We loved the sky light that brightened up the room each day. The blue brocade bedspread made us feel like we were staying in a castle. It was also so great to have a private little patio. The room also had a fire place and even though we didn't use it, it added that little extra bit of romance to the room. Our stay was magical!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Abruptly cancelled”
Reviews.Author: bobatWWC
Reviews.Content: We reserved our room on the Inn's website. Checked availability and put in all the information. We received a confirmation of the reservation. A week later, we got a very abrupt email saying they cancelled our reservation due to not staying enough days in a row. It never came up during our reservation and as I said, we got a confirmation email. We then were not able to get any of the other rooms we were looking at at the time we were making this reservation. Moral of the story is to not believe that you have a reservation until you have checked in.

Reviews.Title: “Best Honeymoon I could have asked for”
Reviews.Author: jenwri
Reviews.Content: This is a quaint little inn with sweet rooms. The service was outstanding and extremely friendly. The hostess was very knowledgeable. I just took my shiney new husband away for a surprise honeymoon and after having canceled at a horrible "resort spa", we found the Christopher Inn. I'd definitely stay here again, it was worth every penny. We were given a pic-nic style breakfast in the morning and had a very comfortable and extremely clean room. After I returned home, I checked out the website and would say it is a very fair idea of what the Inn is like.

Reviews.Title: “Always Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: Geaners
Reviews.Content: Beautiful rooms, cozy bed, fireplace, short walk to "downtown", and breakfast (orange juice, coffee, fruit and yogurt cup, granola, and fresh pastries!!!) delivered to your door! What more could you ask for? This was our second stay at the Christopher's Inn and we wouldn't stay anyplace else in Calistoga! The staff is always friendly and has great tips to help you spend your time in the valley. Very romantic and relaxing! A world away from San Francisco in feel yet only an hour and a half's drive! We highly reccommend the Christopher's Inn to anyone looking to spend the weekend in the Napa valley!

Reviews.Title: “My mother had the best mothers day ever...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I will never stay anywhere else when traveling to Napa and neither will my family. We spent Mothers Day week-end at Christophers Inn and my mother said it was the best mothers day she has ever had. My immiediate family is spread out from California to the East Coast and Christophers Inn made everything so easy for us to coordinate. They were able to accommodate a large family fairly close to the holiday. The basket breakfasts were delightful and delicious. My family can't wait to go back! Thanks again the Lujan Family

Reviews.Title: “Great Little Place”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Found this little gem by accident while taking my wife on her first visit ever to wine country. The staff could not have been any more cordial and the room was fantastic. If I were not in wine country USA, I could have sworn I was in an English inn. As if the garden fountain setting and fireplace in the room was not enough, we awoke to a fantastic "breakfast in a basket" package waiting outside our door first thing in the morning. I plan on a return vist as soon as possible

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced for the service”
Reviews.Author: princesstraveler
Reviews.Content: Although beautiful rooms and quaint surroundings, the service was awful. I had a bad feeling when spoken to rudely in making reservations. This place is way too expensive to be anything but gracious and helpful. At check in, there was only one person on duty and she was trying to escort guests AND check folks in. It was presumed I was with another guest and I was directed to the wrong room. Although helpful with directions to get my own ice (too busy to offer to get it for me, I suppose), she didn't tell me I'd need to take my own bucket from the room, making a second trip across the parking lot necessary. Pastries, yogurt and juice were yummy in the a.m. Coffee was cold and the silverware was dirty. It COULD be fantastic but, alas, it wasn't.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place in the Wine Country”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: While in Calistoga my husband and I had a chance to stay at the Christopher Inn. The room was beautifully decorated and had everything available to us. A basket breakfast was served and left outside our door so we were not disturbed. If you enjoy breakfast in your room, it consisted of coffee, sweet rolls, orange juice, and fresh fruit over a layer of yogurt. The main office had coffee drinks for you to make including expresso. The owners and staff were pleasant and always helpful. I would like to personally thank them for the stay we had in Calistoga. Join them if you can, if you are taking a trip in that direction.

Reviews.Title: “Very Romantic”
Reviews.Author: Natenkaren
Reviews.Content: This is a great Bed and Breakfast for a romantic getaway to the wine country. It is set within easy walking distance to downtown. The rooms offer a lot of privacy and are designed to give a very secluded and romantic feel. One of the best b&b's we have experienced!

Reviews.Title: “A Calistoga 'Jewel'”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently returned from a stay at Calistoga and have discovered a "jewel" there in Christopher's Inn. The room was well furnished and included a hot tub, working fireplace and a private patio with fountain. The bed was enormous with down comforters and breakfast was brought to our door every morning hot and fresh. The staff was also extremely helpful in recommending small local wineries, spas and excellent restaurants nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay every time!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have stayed at Christoper's Inn twice and will return again. It has a wonderful charm and is quite cozy. As I walked into our room there was a fireplace roaring. I hopped onto the bed to watch tv and immediately felt like falling asleep, the bed was so comfortable. Turns out they have the top of the line Serta feather beds. The bed doesn't move at all when you do and is so soft it puts you right to sleep. Not your average hotel bed. My wife and I quickly devised a scheme to trade our bed for this one the next time we visit. The lobby has complimentary espresso. The Inn is a short walk to great restaurants and shops and is very quiet. A tasty breakfast arrived at our doorstep in the morning. I read another review describing the pastries to be greasy. Those people must have woken up on the wrong side of the bed with a wine induced hangover because these tasted home baked and weren't greasy at all. It's the only place where I feel like the room is worth the price and I enjoyed being inside of it. I hope to be back inside soon.

Reviews.Title: “Greatest Calistoga Getaway Ever”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My gilfriend and I have never had a better time than when we visited Calistoga and stayed at Christopher's Inn. The wonderful heart-shaped pastries baked each morning along with numerous other goods delivered to our room made us feel like we had our own bakery catering to the two of us. You do feel so pampered when the breakfast basket arrive at your doorstep and everything is just right. Each day there is a collection of wonderful and different things to see in Calistoga with all the vineyards, restaraunts and peaceful nature that surronds Chrisopher's Inn. We even had fun just sitting around the Christopher's Inn's property. One day we had great fun just relaxing in the lobby making ourselves espresso and cappuccino which we enjoyed by the roaring fire in the beautiful lobby. Another morning we sat by the Italian fountain and once again spoiled ourselves with fresh espresso! What a treat! Everything is walkable to town and there is nothing better than to walk to town, enjoy a lovely dinner and bottle of wine and walk back under the stars! I would like to thank Christopher's Inn and their charming staff for an unforgetable 4 days!

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed in two rooms - moved because TV didn't work (world series). Both rooms had filthy carpets. The breakfast consisted of fruit and cold, greasy pastries. Way overpriced!

Reviews.Title: “To Be Continued”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I spent two nights in a two bedroon cottage with my daughter two weeks ago, and I'm still feeling the after glow. The accomodations were wonderful! Port in the main lobby at night, expressos anytime, lovely stuctures and decor, friendly personel, relaxing, peaceful, a break for the world. I cannot wait to return.
